Description: Temptation of St Antony; the latter seated at centre, surrounded by nude women offering him gifts, one kneeling at left seen from behind Oil, over charcoal (?)
Curator's comments: The saint is here seated at a stone table (see also nos. 1907-7-17-52, 66, 68, 69 and 71) with his hands together. The pig, which appears also in nos. 1907-7-17-52 (see for further comment), 55, 56, 65-68, 71 and 72), is shown between St Antony's legs and those of the female nude on the left. See also no. 1907-7-17-50. 1907-7-17-1 to 90 is a so-called sketchbook, dismembered after its acquisition in 1907. A Title Page inscribed in brown ink is at the beginning of the series. Lit.: H. Tietze and E. Tietze-Conrat, 'The Drawings of the Venetian Painters in the 15th and 16th Centuries', New York, 1944, no. 1526/58, p. 265
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Don Gaspar Mendez de Haro y Guzmán, Marchese del Carpio
Acquisition notes: 1907,0717.1 to 90 have been extracted from a XVIIc album with the title 'Disegni di Giacomo Tintoretto raccolti in Roma dall'Eccmo Sig. Don Gasparo d'Haro e Guzman, Marchese del Carpio .... e nel 1682 eletto Vice Re e Capitano Gnle del Regno di Napoli.' The album covers survive and are kept in the Stationary Cupboard.
